When Muraga was thirteen, the small village in which he lived was attacked by a gang of brigands infamous in Fennes at the time. The gang was led by a powerful warrior whom Muraga fought in order to protect his home. Muraga stood victorious after their battle to the death, claiming this helm worn by the brigandâ€”his first kill. It was far too large for Muraga's small frame, but he would go on to wear it throughout countless bloody battles. Time passed and Muraga grew to become a gargantuan figure, but even on the day he assumed rulership of Fennes, the great helm's golden glow was no less lustrous than when he first claimed it.

A sword that bears the name of a knight from a legend passed through the ages. Also known as the "Knight of the Swan," this figure has been the subject of many songs and plays, which is perhaps why the sword has been sought after by venerable knights across the generations. It is a renowned blade of old that still remains the object of admiration for those on the path of chivalry.

A mask designed like the head of a wolf. Its uncanny resemblance goes beyond its appearanceâ€”it even feels and smells like a wolf, despite using no actual materials from the animal itself. Apparently, this dedication to detail has led an obsessive collector to amass hundreds of them.

A spear imbued with the power of wind, said to unleash whirlwinds from its tip when brandished. It was created using the principles of the spellblades, who instill their blades with magic. As it enhances its user's jumping ability, it is a weapon extremely well suited to dragoons, the specialists of aerial combat.

A bow crafted by the faeries of the forest, capable of eliminating foes without inflicting any suffering. The faeries, throughout their hunts for daily sustenance, have infused the bow with gratitude for the boons of nature and prayers for the departing souls of their prey, and this is said to give rise to the bow's merciful qualities.

As a result of revisions made in not only the length of the handle but also in the design and material properties, it is able to store more magic than the Healing Staff. Though it requires some getting used to, it will allow the wielder to perform somewhat advanced healing magic.

A historic record on battles no matter how big or small, from all ages and locales. This ancient volume contains the legends of "Ibara," a demon who answers the prayers of mortals. It is currently in the possession of Ibara herself, who claims that "there is no finer weapon, after all, than one's own legacy."

A book belonging to Velis, a Warrior of the Crystals. Though nothing is recorded on the white pages within this blue tome and its icy aesthetic, cryptic writing materializes upon the activation of magic. The content of said writing differs with each appearance, and only Velis is able to decipher its meaning. Controlling the tome's magic is an arduous task once it's unleashed, and one touch is all it takes for an amateur to suffer an icy death as their body and soul are instantaneously frozen solid. As such, this manner of book is normally designated as forbidden. It also bears a strong sentience that is short-tempered and vicious, making it difficult to use, but it is obedient to Velis. In fact, it has taken quite a liking to him.

The content of said writing differs with each appearance, and only Velis is able to decipher its meaning. Controlling the tome's magic is an arduous task once it's unleashed, and one touch is all it takes for an amateur to suffer an icy death as their body and soul are instantaneously frozen solid. As such, this manner of book is normally designated as forbidden. It also bears a strong sentience that is short-tempered and vicious, making it difficult to use, but it is obedient to Velis. In fact, it has taken quite a liking to him.

It is said that the mysterious power contained within the stars will awaken the wearer's magical powers to their utmost limit.

A piece of attire brought in from outside Ardra. It is said that in another world, a person of the mystifying profession known as a "Series Producer" wears this when coming before large crowds to speak. While it possesses next to zero defensive qualities, it can set one apart from the group and attract the attention of others. It is thought to have been used to convey some sense of formality.

The mysterious light emitted by the crystal forms a protective aura around the wearer that is particularly effective at keeping vulnerable women and children safe. Highly prized for this reason, it is often given as a proof of friendship and love.

A pendant with the visage of an Ahriman carved into the medallion. The carving itself contains traces of monster fibers, which perhaps explains why the pendant slightly protects its wearer from demonic attacks, while also bolstering the damage they can inflict on demonkind. Surprisingly heavy for its size, it is recommended that one takes regular breaks when wearing this accessory for extended periods of time.

A black jacket brought in from a land beyond Ardra. It is made of a soft cloth, with writing and designs from another world depicted on the back. In that world, it is supposedly the possession of a kind gentleman named Hiroki who gives generous presents, and wearing it is said to bring about some manner of good fortune.

Lara Croft acquired her famous Dual Pistols on her first adventure to the island of Yamatai. They once belonged to Lara's former mentor, Conrad Roth. After his untimely death, Lara inherited the pistols and they have been a treasured part of her collection ever since.

Made of light, durable material, it has a special power that shields the wearer from evil through the divine protection of the Azure Crystal, Astraea. It is as indispensable to her cause as her radiant blue sword.

A radiant blue sword wielded by Elena. Only those found worthy of the Azure Crystal Astraea's favor can wield the energy within, turning it into a blade of pure light. Elena refers to the crystal as her "partner" and seems to wear it mounted on a special gauntlet at all times.

Black earguards from a distant world. They are loved and used by a man with a famously charming smile. It is said that instead of hindering his hearing ability, these earguards actually allow him to hear the many unheard voices that permeate his world. This charismatic individual is believed to use the earguards in order to guide that world toward a better future.

A mantle worn by Astrius. The wearer is granted the blessing of valor and benevolence. It was imbued by a certain benefactor with good fortune for great journeys and the strong desire for freedom bound by none. Astrius embodies these values with his uncompromising will as he travels across worlds.

Resnick's greatcoat, dyed in a purple as deep as a raven's feathers, just like her staff. By draping herself in Heindler's colors, Resnick symbolically takes upon her shoulders the responsibilities and duties of a general of the Six Fangs. The coat can billow open or be secured in front by a firmly fastened belt, and in the same way, it can shield Resnick from magic attacks or enhance the potency of her own spells. The tough fibers of the coat provide resistance to bullets and blades, yet never lose their shimmering luster even in the fiercest of battles.
